explains: adj. 庄严的，值得尊敬的；珍贵的

sentences.en: May Day has become a venerable institution.
sentences.cn: 国际劳动节已经成为一个神圣庄严的既定节日。

sentences.en: Her Chinese friends referred to the empress as their venerable ancestor.
sentences.cn: 她的中国朋友们称那位皇后是令他们尊敬的祖先。

sentences.en: Will you please not suspect my venerable ancestors?
sentences.cn: 请你不要怀疑我那些可敬的老祖宗们，好吗？
